job description:
COME JOIN OUR TEAM! The Boston Globe direct marketing division, Globe Direct, is searching for a full-time Data Analyst to drive client's direct-marketing strategy, outlining data solutions for direct mail, e-mail and multi-channel marketing campaigns.

Responsible for increasing client’s lead generation and response rates across all marketing platforms. Work closely with Sales team and executives to craft a data approach that will maximize client’s return on investment.

Perform various data functions, including the generation of list counts and orders, geo-targeted maps, and ad-hoc and weekly analysis reporting. Lead the conception, organization and execution of mid-year and year-end analysis reports to gauge effectiveness of marketing programs.

Competitive Salary, 401K, and Benefits including Medical, Dental, Vision. Life and Long-term Disability Insurance. Position is 40 hours per week.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Create and implement client campaign strategy, marketing schedules and budgets.
  • Perform advanced analytics including modeling, segmentation, forecasting, and predictive analysis.
  • Provide recommendations for growth, cost reduction and optimization of operational performance.
  • Identify customer demographics for sales campaigns, generate reports, and score data.
  • Identify trends or patterns that impact strategy and future marketing campaigns.
  • Create recommendations and new methods to enhance current analytics.
  • Support the production of new analytical capabilities and solutions to increase campaign results.
  • Work with sales staff creating clients initiatives, providing data sets and demographics for potential and existing sales campaigns.
  • Provide end of campaign reporting results and analysis.
QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Computer Science, Applied Math/Science or related field.
  • 4+ years analytics experience with focus on Marketing or Business Analytics.
  • Proficient in SQL, SAS, DataFlux, Tableau
  • Knowledge of industry best practices in marketing measures, data-mining, experimental design and other statistical techniques.
  • Advanced in Microsoft Office, with focus on Excel and Powerpoint.
  • Training experience.
  • Strong communication, presentation, multi-task and organizational skills, with ability to prioritize and meet strict deadlines.
  • Strong attention to detail, along with strategic thinking and effective problem-solving ability.
  • Team player.
